details: Established judicial review, allowing courts to strike down unconstitutional laws.
Confirmed federal supremacy over state laws and upheld the constitutionality of the national bank.
Strengthened federal power over interstate commerce.
Declared African Americans were not citizens and invalidated the Missouri Compromise.
Upheld racial segregation under the 'separate but equal' doctrine.
Limited free speech during wartime; introduced the 'clear and present danger' test.
Upheld the internment of Japanese Americans during WWII as a national security measure.
Overturned Plessy v. Ferguson; ruled segregation in public schools unconstitutional.
Guaranteed the right to an attorney for criminal defendants in state courts.
Required police to inform suspects of their rights upon arrest.
Legalized abortion nationwide under the right to privacy.
Limited executive privilege; led to Nixonâ€™s resignation.
